name: Apple
notes: Remove seeds (contain cyanide). Feed in moderation due to sugar content.

name: Banana
notes: High in sugar, feed sparingly as a treat.

name: Blueberry
notes: Excellent antioxidants. Can stain fur temporarily.

name: Grape
notes: Cut in half to prevent choking. Remove seeds. High in sugar.

name: Orange
notes: MALE RATS ONLY - d-limonene in citrus may cause kidney issues in male rats.

name: Avocado
notes: Contains persin which is toxic to small animals.

name: Broccoli
notes: Can be fed raw or cooked. May cause gas in large amounts.

name: Carrot
notes: Great for teeth health. Can be fed raw or cooked.

name: Spinach
notes: High in oxalates. Feed sparingly to avoid calcium binding.

name: Onion
notes: Toxic to rodents. Can cause anemia and digestive issues.

name: Garlic
notes: Toxic to rodents. Avoid all forms including powder.

name: Cucumber
notes: Good hydration source. Low in calories.

name: Bell Pepper
notes: High in Vitamin C. All colors are safe.

name: Tomato
notes: Flesh is safe, but leaves and stems are toxic.

name: Chicken
notes: Cooked only, no seasoning. Great protein source.

name: Egg
notes: Cooked only (scrambled or hard-boiled). High in protein.

name: Mealworm
notes: Excellent protein source for rats. Can be fed live or dried.

name: Cheese
notes: Despite stereotypes, feed sparingly. Some rodents are lactose intolerant.

name: Yogurt
notes: Plain, unsweetened only. Good for probiotics.

name: Chocolate
notes: Toxic to rodents. Contains theobromine.

name: Peanut Butter
notes: Can cause choking due to stickiness. Thin spread only.

name: Almond
notes: Unsalted only. Good occasional treat.

name: Sunflower Seed
notes: High in fat, feed sparingly. Unsalted only.

name: Oats
notes: Plain rolled oats are excellent. Good fiber source.

name: Rice
notes: Cooked brown rice is healthier than white.

name: Bread
notes: Whole grain only. Can expand in stomach, feed small amounts.

name: Pasta
notes: Cooked, plain pasta. Whole wheat is preferable.

name: Timothy Hay
notes: Essential for guinea pigs. Good for dental health.

name: Alfalfa Hay
notes: High in calcium. Only for young/pregnant guinea pigs.
